	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The aggregate market value of the registrant's outstanding shares of common stock held by non-affiliates of the registrant (assuming for these purposes, but
	without conceding, that all executive officers and directors are affiliates of the registrant) as of July&nbsp;2, 2015, the last business day of the registrant's most recently completed second
	fiscal quarter, was $1,657,528,468 (based on the $29.26 per share closing price of the registrant's common stock on that date as reported on the New York Stock Exchange).
</FONT>

<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_DA70001_PART_I">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DA70001_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	PART I
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_DA70001_ITEM_1__BUSINESS_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DA70001_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Business.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	The terms "B&amp;G Foods," "our," "we" and "us," as used in this report, refer to B&amp;G Foods,&nbsp;Inc. and its
	wholly owned subsidiaries, except where it is clear that the term refers only to the parent company. Throughout this report, we refer to our fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011,
	December&nbsp;29, 2012, December&nbsp;28, 2013, January&nbsp;3, 2015 and January&nbsp;2, 2016 as "fiscal 2011," "fiscal 2012," "fiscal 2013," "fiscal 2014" and "fiscal 2015," respectively. Our
	fiscal year is the 52 or 53&nbsp;week reporting period ending on the Saturday closest to December&nbsp;31. Fiscal 2014 contained 53&nbsp;weeks and fiscal 2015, 2013, 2012 and 2011 each contained
	52&nbsp;weeks.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B&amp;G
	Foods manufactures, sells and distributes a diverse portfolio of branded, high quality, shelf-stable and frozen food and household products across the United States, Canada and
	Puerto Rico. Many of our branded products have leading regional or national market shares. In general, we position our products to appeal to the consumer desiring a high quality and reasonably priced
	product. We complement our branded product retail sales with institutional and food service sales and limited private label sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B&amp;G
	Foods, including our subsidiaries and predecessors, has been in business for over 120&nbsp;years. We were incorporated in Delaware on November&nbsp;25, 1996 under the name B
	Companies Holdings Corp. On August&nbsp;11, 1997, we changed our name to B&amp;G Foods Holdings Corp. On October&nbsp;14, 2004, B&amp;G Foods,&nbsp;Inc., then our wholly owned subsidiary, was merged
	with and into us and we were renamed B&amp;G Foods,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	company has been built upon a successful track record of both organic and acquisition-related growth. Our goal is to continue to increase sales, profitability and cash flows through
	organic growth, disciplined acquisitions of complementary branded businesses and new product development. Since 1996, we have successfully acquired and integrated more than 40 brands into our company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</FONT>
</P>

	table below includes some of the acquisitions we have completed in recent years:

	brands, from affiliates of American Capital,&nbsp;Ltd., referred to as the "Specialty Brands acquisition" in the remainder of this document.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	July 2015
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Acquisition of Spartan Foods of America,&nbsp;Inc., and related entities, including the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mama Mary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand, from Linsalata Capital Partners and certain other sellers,
	referred to as the "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mama Mary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition" in the remainder of this document.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November 2015
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Acquisition of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Le Sueur
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brands from General Mills,&nbsp;Inc., referred to as the "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition" in the remainder of this document.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Products and Markets
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following is a brief description of some of our brands and product lines:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Le Sueur
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brands trace their roots to Le Sueur, Minnesota in 1903, and
	the Minnesota Valley Canning Company. For more than 100&nbsp;years, fresh and great-tasting
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Le
	Sueur
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	vegetables have been grown and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	picked at the peak of perfection
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in the Valley of the Jolly Green Giant. In the remainder
	of this document, we generally refer to the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Le Sueur
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brands collectively as the
	"
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ortega
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand has been in existence since 1897; its products span the shelf-stable Mexican food segment including taco shells,
	tortillas, seasonings, dinner kits, taco sauces, peppers, refried beans, salsas and related food products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pirate
	Brands, which includes
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Pirate's Booty
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Smart Puffs
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Original Tings
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, originated in 1987 and offers baked,
	trans fat free and gluten free snacks. In 2014, Pirate Brands began offering several varieties of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Pirate's Booty
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	mac&nbsp;&amp; cheese made with organic pasta and real cheese.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Maple Grove Farms of Vermont
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand, which originated in 1915, is one of the leading brands of pure maple syrup sold in the United
	States. Other products under the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Maple Grove Farms of Vermont
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	label include a line of gourmet salad dressings, sugar free syrups, marinades, fruit
	syrups, confections, pancake mixes and organic products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=4,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=51243,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DA70001A.;11',USER='LBURNET',CD=';2-MAR-2016;11:47' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DA70001_1_4">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mrs.&nbsp;Dash
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand, which was introduced in 1983 as the original brand in salt-free seasonings, is available in more than a dozen
	blends. In 2005, the leading brand in salt-free seasonings introduced 6 salt-free marinades.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mrs.&nbsp;Dash's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand essence, "Salt-Free, Flavor-Full,"
	resonates with consumers and underscores the brand's commitment to provide healthy products that fulfill consumers' expectations for taste.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cream of Wheat
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 1893 and is among the leading brands and one of the most trusted and widely recognized brands
	of hot cereals sold in the United States.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cream of Wheat
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is available in Original, Whole Grain and Maple Brown Sugar stove top, and also in instant
	packets of Original and other flavors. We also offer
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cream of Rice
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, a gluten-free, rice-based hot cereal.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Bear Creek Country Kitchens
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand is the leading brand of hearty dry soups in the United States.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Bear Creek
	Country Kitchens
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	also offers a line of savory pasta dishes and hearty rice dishes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mama Mary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 1986 and is a leading brand of shelf-stable pizza crusts.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mama
	Mary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	also offers pizza sauces and premium gourmet pepperoni slices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Las Palmas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand originated in 1922 and primarily includes authentic Mexican enchilada sauce, chili sauce and various pepper products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Polaner
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 1880 and is comprised of a broad array of fruit-based spreads as well as jarred wet spices such as
	chopped garlic and oregano.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Polaner All Fruit
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is a leading national brand of fruit-juice sweetened fruit spread. The spreads are available in more than
	a dozen flavors.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Polaner Sugar Free
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	preserves are the second leading brand of sugar free preserves nationally.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Bloch&nbsp;&amp; Guggenheimer (B&amp;G)
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand originated in 1889, and its pickle, pepper and relish products are a leading brand in the New
	York metropolitan area. This line consists of shelf-stable pickles, peppers, relishes, olives and other related specialty items.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	New York Style
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was created in 1985 and includes Original
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Bagel Crisps
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, Pita
	Chips and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Panetini
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Italian Toast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Spring Tree
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand originated in 1976 in Brattleboro, Vermont, and consists of pure maple syrup and sugar free syrup.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TrueNorth
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 2008.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TrueNorth
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	nut cluster snacks combine freshly
	roasted nuts, a dash of sea salt and just a hint of sweetness.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TrueNorth
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	varieties include almond pecan crunch, chocolate nut crunch and cashew crunch.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	B&amp;M
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 1927 and is the original brand of brick-oven baked beans and remains one of the very few authentic baked
	beans. The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	B&amp;M
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	line includes a variety of baked beans and brown bread. The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	B&amp;M
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand currently has a
	leading market share in the New England region.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Underwood
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand's "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Underwood Devil
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	" logo, which was registered in 1870, is believed to
	be the oldest registered trademark still in use for a prepackaged food product in the United States.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Underwood
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	meat spreads, which were introduced in
	the late 1860s, include deviled ham, white-meat chicken, roast beef, corned beef and liverwurst.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ac'cent
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 1947 as a flavor enhancer for meat preparation and is generally used on beef, poultry, fish and
	vegetables. We believe that
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ac'cent
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is positioned as a unique flavor enhancer that provides food with the "umami" flavor sensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Emeril's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 2000 under a licensing agreement with celebrity chef Emeril Lagasse. We offer a line of pasta sauces,
	seasonings, cooking stocks, mustards, salsas, pepper sauces, dip mixes and cooking sprays under the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Emeril's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand name.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Trappey's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand, which was introduced in 1898, has a Louisiana heritage.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Trappey's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products fall into two major categories&#151;high quality peppers and hot sauces, including
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Trappey's Red Devil
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DA70001_1_5">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Grandma's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand of molasses, which was introduced in 1890, is the leading brand of premium-quality molasses sold in the United States.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Grandma's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	molasses
	products are offered in two distinct styles:
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Grandma's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Original Molasses and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Grandma's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Robust Molasses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Don Pepino
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Sclafani
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brands originated in 1955 and 1900, respectively, and
	primarily include pizza and spaghetti sauces, whole and crushed tomatoes and tomato puree.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Joan of Arc
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand, which originated in 1895, includes a full range of canned beans including kidney, chili and other varieties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Old London
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was created in 1932 and offers a wide variety of flavors available in melba toasts, melba rounds and other snacks.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Old London
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	also markets
	specialty snacks under the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Devonsheer
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	JJ
	Flats
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand names.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Static Guard
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand, the number one brand name in static elimination sprays, created the anti-static spray category when it was
	launched in 1978 to fulfill a previously unmet consumer need. The brand's ability to consistently deliver on its promise to "instantly eliminate static cling" has resulted in a loyal consumer
	following.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand originated in 1904 and is the oldest brand of pure maple syrup in the United States.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	also offers sugar free syrup.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Regina
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand, which has been in existence since 1949, includes vinegars and cooking wines.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Regina
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products are most commonly used in the preparation of salad dressings as well as in a variety of recipe applications, including sauces, marinades
	and soups.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Baker's Joy
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 1982 and is the original brand of no-stick baking spray with flour.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Baker's Joy
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	's product proposition has been to
	"generate a perfect release from the pan every time," making baking easier, faster and more successful for
	everyday bakers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Sugar Twin
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was developed in 1968 and is a calorie free sugar substitute.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Wright's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 1895 and is a seasoning that reproduces the flavor and aroma of pit smoking in meats, chicken and
	fish.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Wright's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is offered in three flavors: Hickory, Mesquite and Applewood.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was created in 2012 and its products include Greek yogurt coated bites.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Brer Rabbit
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand has been in existence since 1907 and currently offers mild and full-flavored molasses as well as blackstrap
	molasses. Mild molasses is designed for table use and full-flavored molasses is typically used in baking, barbeque sauces and as a breakfast syrup.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Sa-s&oacute;n
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand was introduced in 1947 as a flavor enhancer used primarily for Puerto Rican and Hispanic food preparation.
	The product is generally used on beef, poultry, fish and vegetables. The brand's flavor enhancer is offered in four flavors: Original, Coriander and Achiote, Garlic and Onion, and Tomato. We also
	offer reduced sodium versions of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Sa-s&oacute;n
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	New York Flatbreads
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand is a line of thin, crispy, flavorful crispbread that is available in several toppings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Vermont Maid
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand has been in existence since 1919 and offers maple-flavored syrups.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Vermont
	Maid
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	syrup is available in regular, sugar-free and sugar-free butter varieties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Molly McButter
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand created the butter-flavored sprinkles category in 1987.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Molly
	McButter
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is available in butter and cheese flavors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Canoleo
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand is the first margarine made from 100% canola oil. It is an all-purpose margarine used for spreading, cooking and baking.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	5
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=6,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=639288,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DA70001A.;11',USER='LBURNET',CD=';2-MAR-2016;11:47' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DA70001_1_6">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Food Industry
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The food industry is one of the United States' largest industries. It has been characterized by relatively stable sales growth, based
	largely on price and population increases. As large food companies with a presence in a variety of branded product categories seek tighter focus within their businesses, they have shed brands or an
	entire presence in non-core categories. They have also sold smaller brands to increase focus on the larger brands within their portfolios.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the past decade, the retail side of the food industry has seen a continuing shift of sales to alternate food outlets such as supercenters, warehouse clubs, dollar stores and drug
	stores. This shift has caused consolidation of traditional grocery chains into larger entities, often spanning the country under varying banner names. Consolidation has increased the importance of
	having a number one or two brand within a category, be that position national or regional. A broad sales and distribution infrastructure has also become critical for food companies, allowing them to
	reach all outlets selling food to consumers and expanding their growth opportunities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sales, Marketing and Distribution.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Overview.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We sell, market and distribute our products through a multiple-channel sales, marketing and distribution system to all major
	U.S. food
	channels, including sales and shipments to supermarkets, mass merchants, warehouse clubs, wholesalers, food service distributors and direct accounts, specialty food distributors, military commissaries
	and non-food outlets such as drug and dollar store chains. Certain of our brands, including
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cream of
	Wheat
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ac'cent
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Crock Pot
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	seasoning mixes,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Underwood
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Polaner
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Static Guard
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mrs.&nbsp;Dash
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	New York Style
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Sugar Twin
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, are also distributed to similar food channels in Canada. We sell, market and distribute our household brand,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Static Guard
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, through the same sales, marketing and distribution system to many of
	the same customers who buy our food products as well as to other
	household product retailers and distributors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	sell our products primarily through broker sales networks to supermarket chains, food service outlets, mass merchants, warehouse clubs, non-food outlets and specialty distributors.
	The broker sales network handles the sale of our products at the retail level.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our sales organization is aligned by distribution channels and consists of regional sales managers, key account managers and
	sales persons.
	Regional sales managers sell our products nationwide through national and regional brokers, with separate organizations focusing on food service, grocery chain accounts and special markets. Our sales
	managers coordinate our broker sales efforts, make key account calls with buyers or distributors and supervise broker retail coverage of the products at the store level.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	sales strategy is centered on individual brands. We allocate promotional spending for each of our brands and our regional sales managers coordinate promotions with customers.
	Additionally, our marketing department works in conjunction with the sales department to coordinate special account activities and marketing support, such as couponing, public relations and media
	advertising.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have a national sales force that is capable of supporting our current brands and quickly integrating and supporting any newly acquired brands, including the recently acquired
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Marketing.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our marketing organization is aligned by brand and is responsible for the strategic planning for each of our brands. We focus
	on deploying
	promotional dollars where we believe the spending will have the greatest impact on sales. Marketing and trade spending support, on a national basis, typically consists of advertising trade promotions,
	coupons and cross-promotions with supporting products. Radio, internet, social media and limited television advertising supplement this activity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	6
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=7,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=353573,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DA70001A.;11',USER='LBURNET',CD=';2-MAR-2016;11:47' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DA70001_1_7">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Distribution.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We distribute our products through a multiple-channel system that covers every class of customer nationwide. We believe
	that our
	distribution system for shelf-stable products has sufficient capacity to accommodate incremental product volume. See Item&nbsp;2, "Properties" for a listing of our owned and leased distribution
	centers and warehouses. Two of our leased distribution centers are operated for us by a third party logistics provider. A third leased distribution center is currently being transitioned and will soon
	be operated by the same third party logistics provider. In Canada, Mexico and from time to time in the United States we also use public warehouse and distribution facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Warehousing
	and distribution for our recently acquired
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products is currently being managed for us by General Mills pursuant to
	a one-year transition services agreement that expires on November&nbsp;2, 2016. Following the completion of the transition period (which we may choose to terminate prior to the end of the scheduled
	transition period), we will transfer responsibility for warehousing and distribution of the shelf-stable
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products to our existing
	distribution centers and third party logistics provider. We are also contemplating adding a fourth primary distribution center in the United States. However, due to the different demands of
	distribution for shelf-stable and frozen products, we plan to maintain separate distribution systems and are in the process of arranging for third parties to manage the warehousing and distribution of
	the frozen
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green&nbsp;Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products following the completion of the transition period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Customers
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our top ten customers accounted for approximately 52.3% of our net sales and 53.5% of our end of the year receivables for fiscal 2015.
	Other than Wal-Mart, which accounted for 20.4% of our fiscal 2015 net sales, no single customer accounted for 10.0% or more of our fiscal 2015 net sales. Other than Wal-Mart, which accounted for 19.3%
	of our receivables as of the end of fiscal 2015, no single customer accounted for more than 10.0% of our receivables as of the end of fiscal 2015. During fiscal 2015, 2014 and 2013, our net sales to
	foreign countries represented approximately 5.2%, 3.6% and 3.2%, respectively, of our total net sales. Our foreign sales are primarily to customers in Canada. The increase in net sales to foreign
	countries in fiscal 2015 was primarily attributable to the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition completed on November&nbsp;2, 2015. For fiscal 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which
	has significant net sales to Canada, is expected to increase our net sales to foreign countries to approximately 6.7% of our total
	net sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Seasonality
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales of a number of our products tend to be seasonal and may be influenced by holidays, changes in seasons/weather or certain other
	annual events. In general, our sales are higher in the first and fourth quarters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	purchase most of the produce used to make our frozen and shelf-stable canned vegetables, pickles, relishes, peppers, tomatoes and other related specialty items during the months of
	June through October, and we generally purchase the majority of our maple syrup requirements during the months of April through August. Consequently, our liquidity needs are greatest during these
	periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Competition
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We face competition in each of our product lines. Numerous brands and products compete for shelf space and sales, with competition
	based primarily on product quality, convenience, price, trade promotion, consumer promotion, brand recognition and loyalty, customer service, advertising and other activities and the ability to
	identify and satisfy emerging consumer preferences. We compete with numerous companies of varying sizes, including divisions or subsidiaries of larger companies. Many of these competitors have
	multiple product lines, substantially greater financial and other resources and may have lower fixed costs and/or be substantially less leveraged than we are. Our ability to grow our
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	7
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=8,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=127333,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DA70001A.;11',USER='LBURNET',CD=';2-MAR-2016;11:47' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DA70001_1_8">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	business
	could be impacted by the relative effectiveness of, and competitive response to, our product initiatives, product innovation, advertising and promotional activities. In addition, from time to
	time, we experience margin pressure in certain markets as a result of competitors' pricing practices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	products compete not only against other brands in their respective product categories, but also against products in similar or related product categories. For example, our
	shelf-stable pickles compete not only with other brands of shelf-stable pickles, but also with pickle products found in the refrigerated sections of grocery stores, and all our brands compete against
	private label products to varying degrees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Raw Materials
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We purchase raw materials, including agricultural products, meat, poultry, flour, other raw materials, ingredients and packaging
	materials from growers, commodity processors, other food companies and packaging suppliers located in U.S. and foreign locations. The principal raw materials for our products include corn, peas,
	broccoli, beans, maple syrup, wheat, corn, nuts, cheese, fruits, beans, tomatoes, peppers, meat, sugar, concentrates, molasses, spices and corn sweeteners. Vegetables for the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand are
	primarily purchased under dedicated acreage supply contracts from a number of growers prior to each growing season with the
	remaining demand being sourced directly from third parties. We purchase certain other agricultural raw materials in bulk or pursuant to short-term supply contracts. Most of our agricultural products
	are purchased between April&nbsp;1 and October&nbsp;31. We also use packaging materials, particularly glass jars, cans, cardboard and plastic containers. The profitability of our business relies
	in substantial part on the prices we and our co-packers pay for these raw materials and packaging materials, which can fluctuate due to a number of factors, including changes in crop size, national,
	state and local government sponsored agricultural programs, export demand, currency exchange rates, natural disasters, weather conditions during the growing and harvesting seasons, water supply,
	general growing conditions, the effect of insects, plant diseases and fungi, and glass, metal and plastic prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fluctuations
	in commodity prices can lead to retail price volatility and intensive price competition, and can influence consumer and trade buying patterns.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	cost of labor, manufacturing, energy, fuel, packaging materials and other costs related to the production and distribution of our food products can from time to time increase
	significantly and unexpectedly. We attempt to manage these risks by entering into short-term supply contracts and advance commodities purchase agreements, implementing cost saving measures and raising
	sales prices. During the past three years, our cost saving measures and sales price increases have substantially offset increases to our raw material, ingredient and packaging costs. To the extent we
	are unable to offset present and future cost increases, our operating results will be negatively impacted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Production
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Manufacturing.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We operate nine manufacturing facilities for our products. See Item&nbsp;2, "Properties" for a listing of our
	manufacturing
	facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Co-Packing Arrangements.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to our own manufacturing facilities, we source a significant portion of our products under
	"co-packing"
	arrangements, a common industry practice in which manufacturing is outsourced to other companies. We regularly evaluate our co-packing arrangements to ensure the most cost-effective manufacturing of
	our products and to utilize company-owned manufacturing facilities most effectively. Third parties located in U.S. and foreign locations produce our
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Baker's
	Joy
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Bear Creek Country Kitchens
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Canoleo
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cream of
	Rice
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Crock Pot
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	JJ
	Flats
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Joan&nbsp;of&nbsp;Arc
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Le Sueur
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	MacDonald's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mrs.&nbsp;Dash
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	New York Flatbreads
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
	Pirate Brands,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

	Regina
</I>

</I>

	Tree

<FONT SIZE=2>
	products under co-packing agreements or
</FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	8
</FONT>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=9,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=272056,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DA70001A.;11',USER='LBURNET',CD=';2-MAR-2016;11:47' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DA70001_1_9">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	purchase
	orders. Each of our co-packers produces products for other companies as well. We believe that there are alternative sources of co-packing production readily available for the majority of our
	products, although we may experience short-term disturbances in our operations if we are required to change our co-packing arrangements unexpectedly.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Approximately
	60% of the recently acquired
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products are co-packed for us by third-party manufacturers located in the United
	States, Canada, Europe and Peru. General Mills assigned to us as part of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition its rights and obligations under the co-packing
	agreements relating to those products. We manufacture approximately 30% of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products in Irapuato, Mexico at a facility we acquired from
	General Mills as part of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition. The remaining
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products are
	manufactured for us by General Mills at a General Mills facility located in Belvidere, Illinois pursuant to a two-year transition co-packing agreement that expires on November&nbsp;2, 2017. During
	this transition period, we will evaluate shifting this production to either an existing B&amp;G Foods manufacturing facility, a co-packer, or a combination of both.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Trademarks and Licensing Agreements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Trademarks.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We consider our trademarks, in the aggregate, to be material to our business. We protect our trademarks by registration in
	the United
	States, Canada and in other countries where we sell our products. We also oppose any infringement in key markets. Trademark protection continues in some countries for as long as the mark is used and
	in other countries for as long as it is registered. Registrations generally are for renewable, fixed terms. Examples of our trademarks and registered trademarks include
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ac'cent, B&amp;G, B&amp;G Sandwich Toppers, B&amp;M,
	Baker's Joy, Bear Creek Country Kitchens, Brer Rabbit, Canoleo, Cary's, Cream of Rice, Cream of Wheat, Devonsheer, Don Pepino,
	Emeril's, Grandma's, Greek on the go!, Green Giant, JJ Flats, Joan of Arc, Las Palmas, Le Sueur, MacDonald's, Mama Mary's, Maple Grove Farms of Vermont, Molly McButter, Mrs.&nbsp;Dash, New York
	Flatbreads, New&nbsp;York&nbsp;Style, Old London, Original Tings, Ortega, Pirate's Booty, Polaner, Regina, Rickland Orchards, Sa-s&oacute;n, Sclafani, Smart Puffs, Spring Tree, Static
	Guard, Sugar Twin, Trappey's, TrueNorth, Underwood, Vermont Maid
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Wright's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Inbound License Agreements.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;From time to time we enter into in-bound licensing agreements. For example, we sell our
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Emeril's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand products pursuant to a license agreement with Sequential Brands Group,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cream of Wheat
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cinnabon&reg;, a co-branded product, pursuant to a licensing agreement with Cinnabon,&nbsp;Inc. and Crock Pot&reg; Seasoning Mixes pursuant to a licensing agreement with Sunbeam
	Products,&nbsp;Inc. dba Jarden Consumer Solutions. In addition, from time to time, our Pirate Brands products,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cream of Wheat
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products and products of
	certain other of our brands license from third parties, a variety of trademarks, including various Disney, Marvel and Nickelodeon characters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Outbound License Agreements.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We also enter from time to time enter into outbound license agreements for our trademarks. For example, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	trademark is licensed to third parties for use in connection with their sale of fresh produce in the United States and Europe. We also
	license the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	name to General Mills for use with its sale of frozen and shelf stable products in Europe, Asia and in various other locations
	outside of the United States and Canada.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employees and Labor Relations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of January&nbsp;2, 2016, our workforce consisted of 2,003 employees. Of that total, 1,824 employees were engaged in manufacturing,
	78 were engaged in marketing and sales, 63 were engaged in warehouse and distribution and 38 were engaged in administration. Approximately 55% of our employees, located at three facilities in the
	United States and one facility in Mexico, are covered by collective bargaining agreements. The agreements covering employees at the three facilities in the United States, which vary in term depending
	on the location, expire on April&nbsp;29, 2017 (Portland, Maine; Bakery, Confectionery, Tobacco Workers and Grain Millers International Union, AFL-CIO,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	9
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Local
	No.&nbsp;334), March&nbsp;31, 2016 (Stoughton, Wisconsin; Drivers, Salesmen, Warehousemen, Milk Processors, Cannery, Dairy Employees and Helpers Union, Local No.&nbsp;695) and
	March&nbsp;31, 2020 (Roseland, New Jersey; International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Chauffeurs, Warehousemen&nbsp;&amp; Helpers of America, Local No.&nbsp;863). There are two unions representing
	employees at our facility in Mexico, (1)&nbsp;the Industrial Union of Stevedore Workers, Cargo Transport Operators and Similar from the Mexican Republic and (2)&nbsp;the Union of Agriculture
	Workers at the Service of the Region, and our collective bargaining agreements with these two unions do not expire, however, certain terms of the agreements must be reviewed periodically. The
	collective bargaining agreement covering our Stoughton facility, which covers approximately 178 employees, is the only collective bargaining agreement expiring in the next twelve months. While we
	believe that our relations with our union employees are in general good, we cannot assure you that we will be able to negotiate a new collective bargaining agreement for our Stoughton facility on
	terms satisfactory to us, or at all, and without production interruptions, including labor stoppages. At this time, however, management does not expect that the outcome of these negotiations will have
	a material adverse impact on our business, financial condition or results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Government Regulation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a manufacturer and marketer of food and household products, our operations are subject to extensive regulation by the United States
	Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), the Federal Trade Commission (FTC), the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC), the United States Department
	of Labor, the Environmental Protection Agency and various other federal, state, local and foreign authorities regarding the manufacturing, processing, packaging, storage, labeling, sale and
	distribution of our products and the health and safety of our employees. Our manufacturing facilities and products are subject to periodic inspection by federal, state, local and foreign authorities.
	In addition, our meat processing operation in Portland, Maine is subject to daily inspection by the USDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	are subject to the Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act and the Food Safety Modernization Act and the regulations promulgated thereunder by the FDA. This comprehensive regulatory program
	governs, among other things, the manufacturing, composition and ingredients, labeling, packaging and safety of food. We are also subject to the U.S. Bio-Terrorism Act of 2002 which imposes on us
	import and export regulations. Under the Bio-Terrorism Act we are required, among other things, to provide specific information about the food products we ship into the United States and to register
	our manufacturing, warehouse and distribution facilities with the FDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	believe that we are currently in substantial compliance with all material governmental laws and regulations and maintain all material permits and licenses relating to our operations.
	Nevertheless, there can be no assurance that we are in full compliance with all such laws and regulations or that we will be able to comply with any future laws and regulations in a cost-effective
	manner. Failure by us to comply with applicable laws and regulations could subject us to civil remedies, including fines, injunctions, recalls or seizures, as well as potential criminal sanctions, all
	of which could have a material adverse effect on our business, consolidated financial condition, results of operations or liquidity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Environmental Matters
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Environmental Sustainability.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As part of our commitment to being a good corporate citizen, we consider environmental sustainability to
	be an
	important strategic focus area. For instance, our manufacturing operations have a variety of initiatives in place to reduce energy usage, conserve water, improve wastewater management, reduce
	packaging and where possible use recycled and recyclable packaging. We continue to evaluate and modify our manufacturing and other processes on an ongoing basis to further reduce our impact on the
	environment, conserve water and reduce waste.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	10
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Environmental Laws and Regulations.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are also subject to environmental laws and regulations in the normal course of business. We have
	not made any
	material expenditures during the last three fiscal years in order to comply with environmental laws or regulations. Based on our experience to date, we believe that the future cost of compliance with
	existing environmental laws and regulations (and liability for known environmental conditions) will not have a material adverse effect on our business, consolidated financial condition, results of
	operations or liquidity. However, we cannot predict what environmental laws or regulations will be enacted in the future or how existing or future laws or regulations will be enforced, administered or
	interpreted, nor can we predict the amount of future expenditures that may be required in order to comply with such environmental laws or regulations or to respond to such environmental claims.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Available Information
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, we are required to file with or furnish to the SEC annual, quarterly and current
	reports, proxy and information statements and other information. You may read and copy any document we file with the SEC at the SEC's Public Reference Room at 100&nbsp;F Street, NE, Washington, D.C.
	20549. Please call the SEC at 1.800.SEC.0330 for further information about the public reference room. The SEC maintains an internet site at http://www.sec.gov that contains reports, proxy and
	information statements, and other information regarding issuers that file electronically with the SEC. We file electronically with the SEC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	make available, free of charge, through the investor relations section of our web site, our reports on Forms&nbsp;10-K, 10-Q and 8-K, and amendments to those reports, filed with or
	furnished to the SEC as soon as reasonably practicable after they are filed or furnished to the SEC. The address for the investor relations section of our web site is http://ir.bgfoods.com.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	full text of the charters for each of the audit, compensation and nominating and governance committees of our board of directors as well as our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics is
	available at the investor relations section of our web site, http://ir.bgfoods.com. Our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics applies to all of our employees, officers and directors, including our chief
	executive officer and our chief financial officer and principal accounting officer. We intend to disclose any amendment to, or waiver from, a provision of the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics that
	applies to our chief executive officer or chief financial officer and principal accounting officer in the investor relations section of our web site.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	information contained on our web site is not part of, and is not incorporated in, this or any other report we file with or furnish to the SEC.

<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_DC70001_ITEM_1A__RISK_FACTORS_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DC70001_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;1A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Risk Factors.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any investment in our company will be subject to risks inherent to our business. Before making an investment decision, investors should
	carefully consider the risks described below together with all of the other information included in this report. The risks and uncertainties described below are not the only ones facing our company.
	Additional risks and uncertainties that we are not aware of or focused on or that we currently deem immaterial may also impair our business operations. This report is qualified in its entirety by
	these risk factors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any
	of the following risks could materially and adversely affect our business, consolidated financial condition, results of operations or liquidity. In that case, holders of our
	securities may lose all or part of their investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	11
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=12,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=87043,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DC70001A.;10',USER='LBURNET',CD=';2-MAR-2016;11:47' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DC70001_1_12">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Risks Specific to Our Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	The packaged food industry is highly competitive.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The packaged food industry is highly competitive. Numerous brands and products, including private label products, compete for shelf
	space and sales, with competition based primarily on product quality, convenience, price, trade promotion, brand recognition and loyalty, customer service, effective consumer advertising and
	promotional activities and the ability to identify and satisfy emerging consumer preferences. We compete with a significant number of companies of varying sizes, including divisions or subsidiaries of
	larger companies. Many of these competitors have multiple product lines, substantially greater financial and other resources available to them and may have lower fixed costs and/or are substantially
	less leveraged than our company. If we are unable to continue to compete successfully with these companies or if competitive pressures or other factors cause our products to lose market share or
	result in significant price erosion, our business, consolidated financial condition, results of operations or liquidity could be materially and adversely affected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	We may be unable to maintain our profitability in the face of a consolidating retail environment.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our largest customer, Wal-Mart, accounted for 20.4% of our fiscal 2015 net sales, and our ten largest customers together accounted for
	approximately 52.3% of our fiscal 2015 net sales. As the retail grocery trade continues to consolidate and our retail customers grow larger and become more sophisticated, our retail customers may
	demand lower pricing and increased promotional
	programs. Further, these customers are reducing their inventories and increasing their emphasis on products that hold either the number one or number two market position and private label products. If
	we fail to use our sales and marketing expertise to maintain our category leadership positions to respond to these trends, or if we lower our prices or increase promotional support of our products and
	are unable to increase the volume of our products sold, our profitability and financial condition may be adversely affected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	We are vulnerable to decreases in the supply and increases in the price of raw materials and labor,
	manufacturing, distribution and other costs, and we may not be able to offset increasing costs by increasing prices to our customers.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We purchase agricultural products, meat, poultry, other raw materials, ingredients and packaging materials from growers, commodity
	processors, other food companies and packaging manufacturers. Raw materials, ingredients and packaging materials are subject to increases in price attributable to a number of factors, including
	changes in crop size, federal and state agricultural programs, export demand, currency exchange rates, energy and fuel costs, water supply, weather conditions during the growing and harvesting
	seasons, insects, plant diseases and fungi, and glass, metal and plastic prices. Fluctuations in commodity prices can lead to retail price volatility and intensive price competition, and can influence
	consumer and trade buying patterns. The cost of labor, manufacturing, energy, fuel, packaging materials and other costs related to the production and distribution of our products can from time to time
	increase significantly and unexpectedly. We attempt to manage these risks by entering into short-term supply contracts and advance commodities purchase agreements from time to time, by implementing
	cost saving measures and by raising sales prices. During the past three years, our cost saving measures and sales price increases substantially offset increases to our raw material, ingredient and
	packaging costs. To the extent we are unable to offset present and future cost increases, our operating results will be negatively impacted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	12
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=13,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=474858,FOLIO='12',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DC70001A.;10',USER='LBURNET',CD=';2-MAR-2016;11:47' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DC70001_1_13">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	We may be unable to offset any reduction in net sales in our mature food product categories through
	an increase in trade spending for these categories or an increase in net sales in other categories.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Most of our food product categories are mature and certain categories have experienced declining consumption rates from time to time.
	If consumption rates and sales in our mature food product categories decline, our revenue and operating income may be adversely affected, and we may not be able to offset this decrease in business
	with increased trade spending or an increase in sales or profitability of other products and product categories.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	We may have difficulties integrating acquisitions or identifying new acquisitions.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A major part of our strategy is to grow through acquisition. We completed the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mama
	Mary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition in July 2015 and November 2015, respectively, and we expect to pursue
	additional acquisitions of food product lines and businesses. However, we may be unable to identify and consummate additional acquisitions or may be unable to successfully integrate and manage the
	product lines or businesses that we have recently acquired or may acquire in the future. In addition, we may be unable to achieve a substantial portion of any anticipated cost savings from
	acquisitions or other anticipated benefits in the timeframe we anticipate, or at all. Moreover, any acquired product lines or businesses may require a greater than anticipated amount of trade,
	promotional and capital spending. Acquisitions involve numerous risks, including difficulties in the assimilation of the operations, technologies, services and products of the acquired companies,
	personnel turnover and the diversion of management's attention from other business concerns. Any inability by us to integrate and manage any product lines or businesses that we have recently acquired
	or may acquire in the future in a timely and efficient manner, any inability to achieve a substantial portion of any anticipated cost savings or other anticipated benefits from these acquisitions in
	the time frame we anticipate or any unanticipated required increases in trade, promotional or capital spending could adversely affect our business, consolidated financial condition, results of
	operations or liquidity. Moreover, future acquisitions by us could result in our incurring substantial additional indebtedness, being exposed to contingent liabilities or incurring the impairment of
	goodwill and other intangible assets, all of which could adversely affect our financial condition, results of operations and liquidity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	We may be faced with a disruption in sales of certain of our
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Green
	Giant
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	products if we are unable to timely complete a capital project to move production of those products from a General Mills manufacturing facility to one of our
	manufacturing facilities or a co-packer.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Approximately 10% of our
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products are manufactured for us by General Mills
	utilizing equipment we acquired as part of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition and currently located in a General Mills facility in Belvidere, Illinois,
	pursuant to a two-year transition co-packing agreement that expires on November&nbsp;2, 2017. During fiscal 2016, we anticipate initiating a capital project to relocate the acquired Belvidere
	manufacturing equipment to either an existing B&amp;G Foods manufacturing facility, a co-packer, or a combination of both. We anticipate that the project will be completed in fiscal 2017; however, if
	there are any unanticipated delays in the completion of the capital project and our existing inventories of those
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products at the end of the
	transition period are insufficient to meet customer demand, we may face a material disruption in sales that could have a material adverse effect on our financial condition, results of operations and
	liquidity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	We have substantial indebtedness, which could restrict our ability to pay dividends and impact our
	financing options and liquidity position.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At January&nbsp;2, 2016, we had total long-term indebtedness of $1,763.8&nbsp;million (before debt discount), including
	$1,063.8&nbsp;million principal amount of senior secured indebtedness and $700.0&nbsp;million principal amount of senior unsecured indebtedness. Our ability to pay dividends is subject to
	contractual restrictions contained in the instruments governing our indebtedness. Although our credit agreement
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	13
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
	the indenture governing our senior notes (which we refer to as the senior notes indenture) contain covenants that restrict our ability to incur debt, as long as we meet these covenants we will be
	able to incur additional indebtedness. The degree to which we are leveraged on a consolidated basis could have important consequences to the holders of our securities,
	including:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability in the future to obtain additional financing for working capital, capital expenditures or acquisitions may be limited;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	we may not be able to refinance our indebtedness on terms acceptable to us or at all;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a significant portion of our cash flow is likely to be dedicated to the payment of interest on our indebtedness, thereby reducing
	funds available for future operations, capital expenditures, acquisitions and/or dividends on our common stock; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	we may be more vulnerable to economic downturns and be limited in our ability to withstand competitive pressures.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	We are subject to restrictive debt covenants and other requirements related to our debt that limit
	our business flexibility by imposing operating and financial restrictions on our operations.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The agreements governing our indebtedness impose significant operating and financial restrictions on us. These restrictions prohibit or
	limit, among other things:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the incurrence of additional indebtedness and the issuance of certain preferred stock or redeemable capital stock;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the payment of dividends on, and purchase or redemption of, capital stock;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a number of restricted payments, including investments;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	specified sales of assets;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	specified transactions with affiliates;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the creation of certain types of liens;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</DD>
