<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Net
	sales were negatively impacted by the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	shortfall for fiscal 2015, a continuation of the
	weakness that caused us to impair the brand's trademark and customer relationship intangible assets in 2014.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Fiscal
	2015 contained 52&nbsp;weeks and fiscal 2014 contained 53&nbsp;weeks.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	On
	November&nbsp;14, 2014, we announced a voluntary recall for certain
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Ortega
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Las
	Palmas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	products. In connection with the recall, we recorded a $1.2&nbsp;million reduction in net sales related to customer refunds in fiscal 2015. We recorded a reduction of
	net sales, net of insurance recoveries, of $4.1&nbsp;million related to customer refunds in fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gross Profit.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gross profit for fiscal 2015 increased $41.8&nbsp;million, or 16.9%, to $289.6&nbsp;million from $247.8&nbsp;million for
	fiscal
	2014. Gross profit expressed as a percentage of net sales increased to 30.0% in fiscal 2015 from 29.2% in fiscal 2014. The 0.8&nbsp;percentage point increase resulted primarily from price increases,
	partially offset by $6.1&nbsp;million of non-cash amortization of the step-up of inventory acquired in the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition. The increase in
	fiscal 2015 gross profit percentage was also attributable to the negative impact that the fourth quarter of 2014 product recall and write-off of certain raw material and finished goods inventory used
	in the production of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products had on gross profit percentage in fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	46
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling, General and Administrative Expenses.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling, general and administrative expenses increased $12.9&nbsp;million, or 13.9%, to
	$105.9&nbsp;million for fiscal 2015 (which includes $5.7&nbsp;million of incremental operating expenses related to
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) from
	$93.0&nbsp;million for fiscal 2014. The increase was primarily due to increases in general and administrative expenses of $7.7&nbsp;million (primarily consisting of increases in accruals for
	performance-based compensation), warehousing expenses of $4.5&nbsp;million (primarily consisting of $2.7&nbsp;million of distribution restructuring expenses), selling expenses of
	$4.2&nbsp;million (including an increase of $3.4&nbsp;million for salesperson compensation, partially offset by a decrease in brokerage expenses of $0.3&nbsp;million), partially offset by
	decreases in consumer marketing of $2.3&nbsp;million (primarily related to a reduction in demo spending) and acquisition-related expenses of $1.2&nbsp;million. Expressed as a percentage of net
	sales, selling, general and administrative expenses remained flat at 11.0% for fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment of Intangible Assets.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We did not have any impairment of intangible assets during 2015. Impairment of intangible assets of
	$34.2&nbsp;million for fiscal 2014 includes a $26.8&nbsp;million loss for the impairment of amortizable trademarks and a $7.4&nbsp;million loss for the impairment of customer relationship
	intangibles, both relating to
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, due primarily to our reduced projections for net sales to the club channel for the core products
	of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. See Note 6, "Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets" to our consolidated financial statements for a more detailed description of the
	impairment of intangible assets related to
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gain on Change in Fair Value of Contingent Consideration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to the base purchase price consideration paid at closing, the
	acquisition
	agreement for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	requires that we pay additional purchase price earn-out consideration contingent upon the achievement of revenue growth
	targets during fiscal 2014, 2015 and 2016. At the time of the acquisition, we established the fair value
	of the contingent consideration using revenue growth targets meant to achieve operating results in excess of base purchase price acquisition model assumptions. As required, at June&nbsp;28, 2014 we
	remeasured the fair value of the contingent consideration using the actual operating results through June&nbsp;28, 2014 and our revised forecasted operating results for the remainder of fiscal 2014,
	2015 and 2016, and reduced the probability of achievement and the fair value of the contingent consideration to zero. This resulted in a non-cash gain of $8.2&nbsp;million that is included in gain
	on change in fair value of contingent consideration in the accompanying audited consolidated statements of operations for fiscal 2014. See Note&nbsp;6, "Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets" and
	Note&nbsp;8, "Fair Value Measurements," to our consolidated financial statements for a more detailed description of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition
	and related contingent consideration. We did not have any other contingent consideration obligations in fiscal 2015 or fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization Expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization expense decreased $1.4&nbsp;million to $11.3&nbsp;million for fiscal 2015 from $12.7&nbsp;million in
	fiscal
	2014. The decrease is due to the reduction in the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	amortizable intangible assets recorded resulting from the impairment of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brand and customer relationship intangible assets in fiscal 2014, partially offset by the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mama
	Mary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisitions completed in fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating Income.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of the foregoing, operating income increased $56.3&nbsp;million, or 48.5%, to $172.4&nbsp;million in
	fiscal 2015
	from $116.1&nbsp;million in fiscal 2014. Operating income expressed as a percentage of net sales increased 4.1&nbsp;percentage points to 17.8% in fiscal 2015 from 13.7% in fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net Interest Expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net interest expense for fiscal 2015 increased $4.5&nbsp;million, or 9.8%, to $51.1&nbsp;million from
	$46.6&nbsp;million
	in fiscal 2014. The increase was primarily attributable to additional borrowings used to fund the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition. See "&#151;Liquidity
	and Capital Resources&#151;Debt" below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	47
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO70001_1_48">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loss on Extinguishment of Debt.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We did not have a loss on extinguishment of debt in fiscal 2015. Loss on extinguishment of debt for
	fiscal 2014
	includes costs relating to the termination of our prior credit agreement and the repayment of all outstanding obligations thereunder, including the write-off of deferred debt financing costs and
	unamortized discount of $5.4&nbsp;million and $0.3&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income Tax Expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income tax expense increased $29.3&nbsp;million to $52.1&nbsp;million in fiscal 2015 from $22.8&nbsp;million in
	fiscal
	2014. Our effective tax rate was 43.0% in fiscal 2015 and 35.8% in fiscal 2014. Due to an adjustment of deferred taxes for state apportionment as a result of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green
	Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mama Mary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisitions, a deferred tax expense of $7.2&nbsp;million was recorded in fiscal 2015, which increased
	the fiscal 2015 effective tax rate by 5.9&nbsp;percentage points.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fiscal 2014 Compared to Fiscal 2013
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net Sales.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net sales increased $123.0&nbsp;million, or 17.0%, to $848.0&nbsp;million for fiscal 2014 from $725.0&nbsp;million for
	fiscal 2013.
	Our fiscal 2014 contained 53&nbsp;weeks and fiscal 2013 contained 52&nbsp;weeks. We estimate that the extra week in fiscal 2014 contributed approximately $15.0&nbsp;million to the overall
	increase. Additional months of ownership of Specialty Brands, Pirate Brands,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TrueNorth
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in fiscal 2014 as compared to fiscal 2013,
	contributed $133.6&nbsp;million to the overall net sales increase, of which approximately
	$2.5&nbsp;million was due to the extra week.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	sales were negatively impacted by a shortfall in net sales of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	during the fourth quarter of 2014 of
	$11.8&nbsp;million, a continuation of the weakness that caused us to impair the brand. Customer refunds, net of insurance recoveries, related to the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ortega
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Las
	Palmas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	recall negatively impacted fiscal 2014 net sales by $4.1&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Comparable
	base business net sales for fiscal 2014, which excludes the impact of the extra reporting week, acquisitions, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland
	Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	shortfall and customer refunds related to the recall, decreased $7.2&nbsp;million, or 1.0%, for fiscal 2014. The $7.2&nbsp;million decrease was attributable to a
	net price decrease of $5.6&nbsp;million, or 0.8%, and a decrease in unit volume of $1.6&nbsp;million, or 0.2%. Approximately 63% of the net price decrease is attributable to net price decreases
	for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ortega, Maple&nbsp;Grove Farms of Vermont
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	B&amp;M
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products of $2.0&nbsp;million,
	$0.9&nbsp;million and $0.7&nbsp;million, respectively, as we increased promotional activity in response to competition. See Note&nbsp;15, "Net Sales by Brand," to our consolidated financial
	statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of this report, for detailed information regarding total net sales by brand for fiscal 2014 and fiscal 2013 for each of our brands that equals or exceeds 2%
	of our fiscal 2015 net sales and for all other brands in the aggregate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following chart sets forth the most significant net sales increases and decreases by brand for our base business for fiscal 2014 as compared to fiscal 2013. It also shows our total
	base business net
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	48
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	In
	total, Pirate Brands contributed $50.0&nbsp;million to our overall net sales increase for fiscal 2014, $40.7&nbsp;million of which is attributable to
	an extra six months of ownership of Pirate Brands during fiscal 2014 and $9.3&nbsp;million of which is base business growth during the comparable period of ownership during fiscal 2014 and fiscal
	2013.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	In
	total,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	TrueNorth
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	contributed $8.6&nbsp;million to our overall net sales increase for fiscal 2014,
	$7.2&nbsp;million of which is attributable to an extra four months of ownership of the brand during fiscal 2014 and $1.4&nbsp;million of which is base business growth during the comparable period
	of ownership during fiscal 2014 and fiscal 2013.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	In
	total,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	contributed $8.4&nbsp;million to our overall net sales increase for fiscal 2014,
	$20.2&nbsp;million of which is attributable to an additional nine months of ownership of the brand during fiscal 2014, offset by a decrease of $11.8&nbsp;million during the comparable period of
	ownership during fiscal 2014 and fiscal 2013.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	On
	November&nbsp;14, 2014, we announced a voluntary recall for certain
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Ortega
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Las
	Palmas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	products. In connection with the recall, we recorded a reduction of net sales, net of insurance recoveries, of $4.1&nbsp;million related to customer refunds. In
	addition, we temporarily suspended production and distribution of the affected products for several weeks, which we estimate negatively impacted our net sales of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Ortega
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Las
	Palmas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	brands by $4.8&nbsp;million during the fourth quarter of 2014.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(5)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Fiscal
	2014 contained 53&nbsp;weeks and fiscal 2013 contained 52&nbsp;weeks. Net sales attributable to the extra reporting week for fiscal 2014 exclude
	$2.5&nbsp;million of net sales of Specialty Brands attributable to the extra reporting week, which have been excluded for comparability.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gross Profit.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gross profit increased $4.9&nbsp;million, or 2.0%, to $247.8&nbsp;million in fiscal 2014 from $242.9&nbsp;million in
	fiscal 2013.
	Gross profit expressed as a percentage of net sales decreased to 29.2% for fiscal 2014 from 33.5% in fiscal 2013. The 4.3&nbsp;percentage point decrease was due in part to the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ortega
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	49
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=50,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=617974,FOLIO='49',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DO70001A.;22',USER='SMENEZE',CD=';1-MAR-2016;22:53' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO70001_1_50">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	and Las Palmas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	recall and the write-off of certain raw material and finished goods inventory used in the production of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland
	Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products (See Note&nbsp;6, "Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets," to our consolidated financial statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of this report, for
	detailed information regarding this write-off), which reduced gross profit margin by approximately 1.4&nbsp;percentage points and 0.5&nbsp;percentage points, respectively. Excluding the impact of
	the recall and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	inventory write-off, gross profit as a percentage of net sales was 31.1%. The remaining gross profit shortfall of
	2.4&nbsp;percentage points was attributable to an increase in distribution costs, the base business net price decrease described above, a sales mix shift to lower margin products and the negative
	impact of the Canadian exchange rate, which reduced gross profit margin by approximately 1.0&nbsp;percentage points, 0.6&nbsp;percentage points, 0.6&nbsp;percentage points and
	0.2&nbsp;percentage points, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling, General and Administrative Expenses.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling, general and administrative expenses increased $14.0&nbsp;million, or 17.7%, to
	$93.0&nbsp;million for fiscal 2014 from $79.0&nbsp;million for fiscal 2013. This increase was primarily due to recent acquisitions. During fiscal 2014, we experienced increases in consumer
	marketing of $4.9&nbsp;million, brokerage expenses of $3.5&nbsp;million, warehousing expenses of $2.4&nbsp;million, acquisition-related expenses of $1.4&nbsp;million, administrative expenses
	related to the product recall of $0.5&nbsp;million and all other expenses of $1.3&nbsp;million. Expressed as a percentage of net sales, our selling, general and administrative expenses increased
	to 11.0% in fiscal 2014 from 10.9% in fiscal 2013 because the increases in selling, general and administrative expenses were primarily the result of recent acquisitions that also resulted in increased
	net sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment of Intangible Assets.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment of intangible assets of $34.2&nbsp;million for fiscal 2014 includes a $26.8&nbsp;million
	loss for the
	impairment of amortizable trademarks and a $7.4&nbsp;million loss for the impairment of customer relationship intangibles, both relating to
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland
	Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, due primarily to our reduced projections for net sales to the club channel for the core products of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.
	We did not have any impairment of intangible assets during 2013. See Note&nbsp;6, "Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets" to our consolidated financial statements for a more detailed description of
	the impairment of intangible assets related to
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gain on Change in Fair Value of Contingent Consideration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to the base purchase price consideration paid at closing, the
	acquisition
	agreement for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	requires that we pay additional purchase price earn-out consideration contingent upon the achievement of revenue growth
	targets during fiscal 2014, 2015 and 2016. At the time of the acquisition, we established the fair value of the contingent consideration using revenue growth targets meant to achieve operating results
	in excess of base purchase price acquisition model assumptions. As required, at June&nbsp;28, 2014 we
	remeasured the fair value of the contingent consideration using the actual operating results through June&nbsp;28, 2014 and our revised forecasted operating results for the remainder of fiscal 2014,
	2015 and 2016, and reduced the probability of achievement and the fair value of the contingent consideration to zero. This resulted in a non-cash gain of $8.2&nbsp;million that is included in gain
	on change in fair value of contingent consideration in the accompanying audited consolidated statements of operations for fiscal 2014. See Note&nbsp;6, "Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets" and
	Note&nbsp;8, "Fair Value Measurements," to our consolidated financial statements for a more detailed description of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition
	and related contingent consideration. We did not have any contingent consideration obligations in fiscal 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization Expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization expense increased $2.8&nbsp;million to $12.7&nbsp;million for fiscal 2014 from $9.9&nbsp;million in
	fiscal
	2013. The increase is due to the Specialty Brands acquisition in fiscal 2014 and the full year impact of amortization related to the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Pirate Brands and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TrueNorth
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisitions completed in fiscal 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating Income.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of the foregoing, operating income decreased $37.9&nbsp;million, or 24.6%, to $116.1&nbsp;million in
	fiscal 2014
	from $154.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2013. Operating income expressed as a percentage of net sales decreased 7.5&nbsp;percentage points to 13.7% in fiscal 2014 from 21.2% in fiscal 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	50
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=51,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=5630,FOLIO='50',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DO70001A.;22',USER='SMENEZE',CD=';1-MAR-2016;22:53' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO70001_1_51">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net Interest Expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net interest expense in fiscal 2014 increased $4.8&nbsp;million to $46.6&nbsp;million from $41.8&nbsp;million in
	fiscal
	2013. The increase was primarily due to the increase in our average debt outstanding attributable to our recent acquisitions. See "&#151;Liquidity and Capital Resources&#151;Debt" below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loss on Extinguishment of Debt.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loss on extinguishment of debt for fiscal 2014 includes costs relating to the termination of our prior
	credit
	agreement and the repayment of all outstanding obligations thereunder, including the write-off of deferred debt financing costs and unamortized discount of $5.4&nbsp;million and $0.3&nbsp;million,
	respectively. Loss on extinguishment of debt for fiscal 2013 includes costs
	relating to our repurchase of $248.5&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of 7.625% senior notes and our repayment of $222.2&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of tranche&nbsp;B term
	loans, including the repurchase premium and other expenses of $20.2&nbsp;million, the write-off of deferred debt financing costs of $8.3&nbsp;million and the write-off of unamortized discount of
	$2.8&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income Tax Expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income tax expense decreased $5.7&nbsp;million to $22.8&nbsp;million in fiscal 2014 from $28.5&nbsp;million in
	fiscal 2013.
	Our effective tax rate was 35.8% in fiscal 2014 and 35.3% in fiscal 2013. Due to changes in state apportionments, a deferred tax benefit of $0.3&nbsp;million, or 0.4%, was recorded in fiscal 2013.
	There was no change in state apportionment in fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our primary liquidity requirements include debt service, capital expenditures and working capital needs. See also, "Dividend Policy"
	and "Commitments and Contractual Obligations" below. We fund our liquidity requirements, as well as our dividend payments and financing for acquisitions, primarily through cash generated from
	operations and external sources of financing, including our revolving credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cash Flows
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net Cash Provided by Operating Activities.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash provided by operating activities increased $29.4&nbsp;million to
	$128.5&nbsp;million in
	fiscal 2015 from $99.1&nbsp;million in fiscal 2014. Net cash provided by operating activities for fiscal 2013 was $114.9&nbsp;million. The increase in net cash provided by operating activities in
	fiscal 2015 as compared to fiscal 2014 was primarily due to increased acquisition-related sales, offset by decreased costs associated with the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ortega
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Las Palmas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	recall and acquisition-related integration costs that resulted in an increase in net income before depreciation, amortization, loss on
	extinguishment of debt and other non-cash expenses, and a reduction in net working capital costs. The decrease in net cash provided by operating activities in fiscal 2014 as compared to fiscal 2013
	was due to costs associated with the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Ortega
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Las Palmas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	recall, recent acquisitions and related
	integration inefficiencies that resulted in a decrease in net income before depreciation, amortization, loss on extinguishment of debt and other non-cash expenses, and higher net working capital
	costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net Cash Used in Investing Activities.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash used in investing activities was $892.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2015 as compared to
	$173.3&nbsp;million in fiscal 2014 and $261.9&nbsp;million for fiscal 2013. During fiscal 2015, our net cash used in investing included $822.8&nbsp;million and $51.0&nbsp;million for the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mama Mary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisitions (net of cash acquired), respectively, and $18.6&nbsp;million
	of capital expenditures. During fiscal 2014, our net cash used in investing included $154.3&nbsp;million for the Specialty Brands acquisition and $19.0&nbsp;million of capital expenditures. During
	fiscal 2013, our net cash used in investing activities included $247.3&nbsp;million for the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TrueNorth
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, Pirate Brands and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Rickland Orchards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisitions and
	$14.6&nbsp;million of capital expenditures. Our capital expenditures typically include expenditures for building
	improvements, purchases of manufacturing and computer equipment and capitalized interest. During fiscal 2016, we expect that our capital expenditures will be approximately $32.5&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	51
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net Cash Provided by Financing Activities.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash provided by financing activities was $767.4&nbsp;million, $71.6&nbsp;million, and
	$131.8&nbsp;million in fiscal 2015, fiscal 2014 and fiscal 2013, respectively. The increase in net cash provided by financing activities from fiscal 2014 to fiscal 2015 was primarily the result of
	increased borrowings used to fund the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition and our fiscal 2015 equity offering. The decrease from fiscal 2013 to fiscal 2014 was
	primarily the result of reduced acquisition activity, which reduced our need to incur additional debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	fiscal 2015, net cash provided by financing activities includes $746.3&nbsp;million of net proceeds from tranche&nbsp;B term loan borrowings under our credit agreement, $126.2 of
	net proceeds from our public offering of common stock and $6.0&nbsp;million of net proceeds from borrowings under our revolving credit facility. Net cash provided by financing activities was
	partially offset by $76.5&nbsp;million of dividend payments, $18.8&nbsp;million of scheduled principal payments of tranche&nbsp;A term loans, and $14.5&nbsp;million for the payment of deferred
	financing costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	fiscal 2014, net cash provided by financing activities includes $229.3&nbsp;million of proceeds from the refinancing of our term loan borrowings and revolving credit facility and
	$2.3&nbsp;million of excess tax benefits from share-based compensation. Net cash provided by financing activities was partially offset by the repayment of $138.8&nbsp;million tranche&nbsp;A term
	loans, $72.4&nbsp;million of dividends payments, $8.5&nbsp;million for the payment of deferred financing costs and $6.0&nbsp;million of repayments of revolving loans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	fiscal 2013, net cash provided by financing activities includes $700.0&nbsp;million of proceeds from the issuance of our 4.625% senior notes, $15.0&nbsp;million of proceeds from
	borrowings under our revolving credit facility (net of $90.0&nbsp;million of repayments of revolving loans) and $4.2&nbsp;million of excess tax benefits from share-based compensation. Net cash
	provided by financing activities was reduced for the repurchase and redemption of $248.5&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of 7.625% senior notes, the repayment of $222.2&nbsp;million
	aggregate principal amount of tranche&nbsp;B term loans, including the repurchase premiums and other expenses of $20.2&nbsp;million and $14.2 of scheduled principal payments of tranche&nbsp;A
	and tranche&nbsp;B term loans; $62.8&nbsp;million of dividend payments; $12.6&nbsp;million for the payment of deferred financing costs and $6.8&nbsp;million for the payment of tax withholding
	on behalf of employees for net share settlement of share-based compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash Income Tax Payments.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on a number of factors, including amortization for tax purposes of our trademark, goodwill and other
	intangible
	assets acquired in prior acquisitions, we realized a significant reduction in cash taxes in fiscal 2015, 2014 and 2013 as compared to our tax expense for financial reporting purposes. We believe that
	we will realize a benefit to our cash taxes payable from amortization of our trademarks, goodwill and other intangible assets for the taxable years 2016 through 2030. If there is a change in U.S.
	federal tax policy that reduces any of these available deductions or results in an increase in our corporate tax rate, our cash taxes payable may increase further, which could significantly reduce our
	future cash and impact our ability to make interest and dividend payments.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Dividend Policy
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For a discussion of our dividend policy, see the information set forth under the heading "Dividend Policy" in Part&nbsp;II,
	Item&nbsp;5 of this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Acquisitions
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our liquidity and capital resources have been significantly impacted by acquisitions and may be impacted in the foreseeable future by
	additional acquisitions. As discussed elsewhere in this report, as part of our growth strategy we plan to expand our brand portfolio with disciplined acquisitions of complementary brands. We have
	historically financed acquisitions by incurring additional indebtedness, issuing equity and/or using cash flows from operating activities. Our interest expense has over time
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	52
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=53,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=536308,FOLIO='52',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DO70001A.;22',USER='SMENEZE',CD=';1-MAR-2016;22:53' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO70001_1_53">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	increased
	as a result of additional indebtedness we have incurred in connection with acquisitions and will increase with any additional indebtedness we may incur to finance future acquisitions.
	Although we may subsequently issue equity and use the proceeds to repay all or a portion of the additional indebtedness incurred to finance an acquisition and reduce our interest expense, the
	additional shares of common stock would increase the amount of cash flows from operating activities necessary to fund dividend payments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	financed the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mama Mary's
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition, completed in July 2015, with cash on hand from the proceeds of a public offering of common stock
	we completed in May 2015. We financed the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green&nbsp;Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition, completed in November 2015, with additional indebtedness as described below.
	The impact of future acquisitions, whether financed with additional indebtedness or otherwise, may have a material impact on our liquidity and capital resources.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Debt
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Senior Secured Credit Agreement.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On October&nbsp;2, 2015, we amended and restated our existing senior secured credit agreement dated as
	of
	June&nbsp;5, 2014. The amendment provided for an incremental tranche&nbsp;B term loan facility to be made available under the credit agreement to finance a portion of the purchase price for the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition. On November&nbsp;2, 2015, we funded the purchase price, inventory adjustment at closing, initial working capital requirements
	and related transaction fees and expenses for the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition with additional revolving loans and $750.0&nbsp;million of tranche&nbsp;B
	term loans under the credit agreement. At January&nbsp;2, 2016, $273.8&nbsp;million of tranche&nbsp;A term loans, $750.0&nbsp;million of tranche&nbsp;B term loans and $40.0&nbsp;million of
	revolving loans were outstanding under our credit agreement. The credit agreement is secured by substantially all of our and our domestic subsidiaries' assets except our and our domestic subsidiaries'
	real property.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	January&nbsp;2, 2016, the available borrowing capacity under our revolving credit facility, net of outstanding letters of credit of $2.0&nbsp;million, was $458.0&nbsp;million.
	Proceeds of the revolving credit facility may be used for general corporate purposes, including acquisitions of targets in the same or a similar line of business as our company, subject to specified
	criteria. The revolving credit facility matures on June&nbsp;5, 2019.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	tranche&nbsp;A term loans are subject to principal amortization. $7.5&nbsp;million was due and paid in fiscal 2014, $18.8&nbsp;million was due and paid in fiscal 2015,
	$26.2&nbsp;million is due and payable in fiscal 2016, $24.4&nbsp;million is due and payable in fiscal 2017 and $76.9&nbsp;million is due and payable in fiscal 2018. The balance of all borrowings
	under the tranche&nbsp;A term loan facility, or $146.2&nbsp;million, is due and payable at maturity on June&nbsp;5, 2019. The tranche&nbsp;B term loans mature on November&nbsp;2, 2022 and
	are subject to amortization at the rate of 1% per year, with $7.5&nbsp;million due and payable in each of fiscal years 2016 through 2021 and $705.0&nbsp;million due and payable in fiscal 2022.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	under the revolving credit facility, including any outstanding letters of credit, and under the tranche&nbsp;A term loan facility, is determined based on alternative rates
	that we may choose in accordance with the credit agreement, including a base rate per annum plus an applicable margin ranging from 0.50% to 1.00%, and LIBOR plus an applicable margin ranging from
	1.50% to 2.00%, in each case depending on our consolidated leverage ratio. At January&nbsp;2, 2016, the revolving credit facility and the tranche&nbsp;A term loan interest rates were approximately
	2.29% and 2.36%, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	under the tranche&nbsp;B term loan facility is determined based on alternative rates that we may choose in accordance with the credit agreement, including a base rate per
	annum plus an applicable margin of 2.00%, and LIBOR plus an applicable margin of 3.00%. At January&nbsp;2, 2016, the tranche&nbsp;B term loan interest rate was approximately 3.75%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	53
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	further information regarding our credit agreement, including a description of optional and mandatory prepayment terms, and financial and restrictive covenants, see Note 7,
	"Long-Term Debt," to our consolidated financial statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.625% Senior Notes due 2021.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On June&nbsp;4, 2013, we issued $700.0&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of 4.625% senior notes due
	2021 at a
	price to the public of 100% of their face value. We used the net proceeds from the issuance of the 4.625% senior notes to purchase or redeem all $248.5&nbsp;million principal amount of our then
	existing 7.625% senior notes due 2018, to repay $222.2&nbsp;million principal amount of tranche&nbsp;B term loans and approximately $40.0&nbsp;million principal amount of revolving loans under
	our credit agreement, and to pay related premiums, fees and expenses. We used the remaining net proceeds for the Pirate Brands acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	on the 4.625% senior notes is payable on June&nbsp;1 and December&nbsp;1 of each year. The 4.625% senior notes will mature on June&nbsp;1, 2021, unless earlier retired or
	redeemed as permitted or required by the terms of the indenture governing the 4.625% senior notes as described in Note&nbsp;7, "Long-Term
	Debt," to our consolidated financial statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of this report. We may also, from time to time, seek to retire the 4.625% senior notes through cash repurchases of the
	4.625% senior notes or exchanges of the 4.625% senior notes for equity securities or both, in open market purchases, privately negotiated transactions or otherwise. Such repurchases or exchanges, if
	any, will depend on prevailing market conditions, our liquidity requirements, contractual restrictions and other factors. The amounts involved may be material. See Note&nbsp;7, "Long-Term Debt," to
	our consolidated financial statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of this report for a more detailed description of the 4.625% senior notes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred Debt Financing Costs.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During fiscal 2015, we capitalized $14.5&nbsp;million of debt financing costs relating to the
	tranche&nbsp;B term
	loans, which are being amortized over the seven year scheduled term of the tranche&nbsp;B term loans. During fiscal 2014, we wrote-off and expensed $5.4&nbsp;million of deferred debt financing
	costs relating to the termination of our prior credit agreement, which included the repayment of $121.9&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of our tranche&nbsp;A term loans and
	$215.0&nbsp;million of revolving loans. During fiscal 2014, we also capitalized $5.6&nbsp;million and $2.9&nbsp;million of debt financing costs relating to the new revolving credit facility and
	tranche&nbsp;A term loans, respectively, which are being amortized over the five year scheduled term of the revolving credit facility and tranche&nbsp;A term loans. During fiscal 2013, we
	wrote-off and expensed $8.3&nbsp;million of deferred debt financing costs relating to the repayment of the $248.5&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of 7.625% senior notes and our repayment
	of $222.2&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of tranche&nbsp;B term loans. During fiscal 2013, we also capitalized $12.2&nbsp;million of debt financing costs, which are being amortized over
	the eight year scheduled term of the 4.625% senior notes and we also capitalized $0.4&nbsp;million of debt financing costs in connection with an amendment to our credit facility, which are being
	amortized over the remainder of the five year scheduled term of our revolving credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Future Capital Needs
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On January&nbsp;2, 2016, our total long-term debt of $1,759.6&nbsp;million, net of our cash and cash equivalents of
	$5.2&nbsp;million, was $1,754.4&nbsp;million. Stockholders' equity as of that date was $457.7&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	ability to generate sufficient cash to fund our operations depends generally on our results of operations and the availability of financing. Our management believes that our cash and
	cash equivalents on hand, cash flow from operating activities and available borrowing capacity under our revolving credit facility will be sufficient for the foreseeable future to fund operations,
	meet debt service requirements, fund capital expenditures, make future acquisitions, if any, and pay our anticipated quarterly dividends on our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	54
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ70001_1_55">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->

</P>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We expect to make capital expenditures of approximately $26.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2016 in respect of our existing operations. In addition, in connection with
	the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	acquisition, we anticipate making an additional one-time capital expenditure of approximately $10.0&nbsp;million to
	$15.0&nbsp;million over the course of fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2017 in order to move equipment used in the production of certain
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Green Giant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products
	from General Mills' Belvidere, Illinois manufacturing facility to either an existing B&amp;G Foods manufacturing facility, a co-packer, or a combination of both.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Seasonality
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales of a number of our products tend to be seasonal and may be influenced by holidays, changes in seasons or certain other annual
	events. In general our sales are higher during the first and fourth quarters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	purchase most of the produce used to make our shelf-stable pickles, relishes, peppers, tomatoes and other related specialty items during the months of June through October, and we
	generally purchase the majority of our maple syrup requirements during the months of April through August. Consequently, our liquidity needs are greatest during these periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Inflation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are currently locked into pricing and supply for substantially all of our major commodities, other than maple syrup, through fiscal
	2016 at a cost increase of less than 1% of cost of goods sold and will continue to manage inflation risk by entering into short-term supply contracts and advance commodities purchase agreements from
	time to time, and, if necessary, by raising prices. During each of fiscal 2015 and fiscal 2014 we had a minimal cost decrease. To the extent we are unable to avoid or offset any present or future cost
	increases by locking in our costs, implementing cost saving measures or increasing prices to our customers, our operating results could be materially and adversely affected. In addition, should input
	costs begin to further decline, customers may look for price reductions in situations where we have locked into purchases at higher costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See Note 13, "Commitments and Contingencies," to our consolidated financial statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See Note 2(s), "Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&#151;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Recently Issued Accounting
	Standards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	," to our consolidated financial statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Off-balance Sheet Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of January&nbsp;2, 2016, we did not have any off-balance sheet arrangements as defined in Item&nbsp;303(a)(4)(ii) of
	Regulation&nbsp;S-K.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	55
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Expected
	interest payments on long-term debt are based on principal amounts outstanding, scheduled maturity dates and interest rates at January&nbsp;2,
	2016. See Note 7, "Long-Term Debt," to our consolidated financial statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 for further information as to our long-term debt interest obligations.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	For
	the purposes of this table, purchase obligations means agreements to purchase goods or services (such as raw materials, commodities, packaging, other
	materials and supplies and co-manufacturing arrangements) that are enforceable and legally binding on B&amp;G Foods and that specify all significant terms, including: fixed or minimum quantities to be
	purchased; fixed, minimum or variable price provisions; and the approximate timing of the transaction. The purchase obligations in the above table do not represent our entire expected future purchases
	for goods and services, which are significantly higher than the amounts set forth above. The table does not include purchase obligations under contracts that may be cancelled by B&amp;G&nbsp;Foods
	without material penalty. Any amounts reflected on our consolidated balance sheet as accounts payable and accrued liabilities are excluded from the purchase obligations set forth in the table above.
	Penalties, if any, related to molds and equipment based upon failure to meet minimum volume requirements are also excluded from the table because we are unable to determine whether such penalties will
	be incurred and, if incurred, over what time period they will be paid.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	We
	expect to make $3.5&nbsp;million of defined pension benefit contributions during fiscal 2016. We are unable to reliably estimate the timing of pension
	contributions and contribution amounts beyond fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Forward-Looking Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This report includes forward-looking statements, including without limitation the statements under "Management's Discussion and
	Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations." The words "believes," "anticipates," "plans," "expects," "intends," "estimates," "projects" and similar expressions are intended to identify
	forward-looking statements. These forward looking statements involve known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors that may cause our actual results, performance and achievements, or
	industry results, to be materially different from any future results, performance, or achievements expressed or implied by any forward-looking statements. We believe important factors that could cause
	actual results to differ materially from our expectations include the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our substantial leverage;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the effects of rising costs for our raw materials, packaging and ingredients;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	crude oil prices and their impact on distribution, packaging and energy costs;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability to successfully implement sales price increases and cost saving measures to offset any cost increases;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	intense competition, changes in consumer preferences, demand for our products and local economic and market conditions;
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	56
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ70001_1_57">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our continued ability to promote brand equity successfully, to anticipate and respond to new consumer trends, to develop new products
	and markets, to broaden brand portfolios in order to compete effectively with lower priced products and in markets that are consolidating at the retail and manufacturing levels and to improve
	productivity;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the risks associated with the expansion of our business;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our possible inability to identify new acquisitions or to integrate recent or future acquisitions or our failure to realize
	anticipated revenue enhancements, cost savings or other synergies;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability to access the credit markets and our borrowing costs and credit ratings, which may be influenced by credit markets
	generally and the credit ratings of our competitors;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	unanticipated expenses, including, without limitation, litigation or legal settlement expenses;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the effects of currency movements of the Canadian dollar and the Mexican peso as compared to the U.S. dollar;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	future impairments of our goodwill and intangible assets;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our sustainability initiatives and changes to environmental laws and regulations;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	other factors that affect the food industry generally, including:
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	recalls if products become adulterated or misbranded, liability if product consumption causes injury, ingredient disclosure and
	labeling laws and regulations and the possibility that consumers could lose confidence in the safety and quality of certain food products;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	competitors' pricing practices and promotional spending levels;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	fluctuations in the level of our customers' inventories and credit and other business risks related to our customers operating in a
	challenging economic and competitive environment; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the risks associated with third-party suppliers and co-packers, including the risk that any failure by one or more of our third-party
	suppliers or co-packers to comply with food safety or other laws and regulations may disrupt our supply of raw materials or certain finished goods products or injure our reputation; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	other factors discussed elsewhere in this report, including under Item&nbsp;1A, "Risk Factors," and in our other public filings with
	the SEC.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developments
	in any of these areas could cause our results to differ materially from results that have been or may be projected by or on our behalf.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
	forward-looking statements included in this report are based on information available to us on the date of this report. We undertake no obligation to publicly update or revise any
	forward-looking statement, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. All subsequent written and oral forward-looking statements attributable to us or persons acting on our
	behalf are expressly qualified in their entirety by the cautionary statements contained in this report.
</FONT>
</P>

	should evaluate all forward-looking statements made in this report in the context of these risks and uncertainties. We urge investors not to unduly rely on forward-looking statements contained in this

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=58,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=496199,FOLIO='57',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DQ70001A.;15',USER='WWASSER',CD=';2-MAR-2016;14:44' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ70001_1_58">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
</EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_DQ70001_ITEM_7A__QUANTITATIVE_AND_QUAL__ITE02650">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DQ70001_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;7A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our principal market risks are exposure to changes in commodity prices, interest rates on borrowings and foreign currency exchange
	rates and market fluctuation risks related to our defined benefit pension plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Commodity Prices and Inflation.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The information under the heading "Inflation" in Item&nbsp;7, "Management's Discussion and Analysis of
	Financial
	Condition and Results of Operations" is incorporated herein by reference.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest Rate Risk.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the normal course of operations, we are exposed to market risks relating to our long-term debt arising from
	adverse changes in
	interest rates. Market risk is defined for these purposes as the potential change in the fair value of a financial asset or liability resulting from an adverse movement in interest rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes
	in interest rates impact our fixed and variable rate debt differently. For fixed rate debt, a change in interest rates will only impact the fair value of the debt, whereas for
	variable rate debt, a change in the interest rates will impact interest expense and cash flows. At January&nbsp;2, 2016, we had $700.0&nbsp;million of fixed rate debt and $1,063.8&nbsp;million
	of variable rate debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
	upon our principal amount of long-term debt outstanding at January&nbsp;2, 2016, a hypothetical 1.0% increase or decrease in interest rates would have affected our annual
	interest expense by approximately $10.6&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	carrying values and fair values of our revolving credit loans, term loans and senior notes as of January&nbsp;2, 2016 and January&nbsp;3, 2015 are as follows (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_18"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">

</FONT>
</P>

<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Fair
	values are estimated based on Level&nbsp;2 inputs, which were quoted prices for identical or similar instruments in markets that are not active.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	The
	carrying values of the tranche&nbsp;A term loans are net of discount. At January&nbsp;2, 2016 and January&nbsp;3, 2015, the face amounts of the
	tranche&nbsp;A term loans was $273.8&nbsp;million and $292.5&nbsp;million, respectively.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	The
	carrying values of the tranche&nbsp;B term loans are net of discount. At January&nbsp;2, 2016, the face amount of the tranche&nbsp;B term loans
	was $750.0&nbsp;million.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Fair
	values are estimated based on quoted market prices.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash
	and cash equivalents, trade accounts receivable, income tax receivable, trade accounts payable, accrued expenses and dividends payable are reflected on our consolidated balance
	sheets at carrying value, which approximates fair value due to the short-term nature of these instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	more information, see Note 7, "Long-Term Debt," to our consolidated financial statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Foreign Currency Risk.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our foreign sales are primarily to customers in Canada. Our sales to Canada are generally denominated in
	Canadian dollars and
	our sales for export to other countries are generally denominated in U.S. dollars. During fiscal 2015, 2014 and 2013, our net sales to foreign countries represented approximately 5.2%, 3.6% and 3.2%,
	respectively, of our total net sales. We also purchase certain raw materials from foreign suppliers. For example, we purchase a significant majority of our maple syrup requirements from suppliers in
	Qu&eacute;bec, Canada. These purchases are made in
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	58
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=59,EFW="2227533",CP="B&G FOODS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=29127,FOLIO='58',FILE='DISK132:[15ZCW1.15ZCW70001]DQ70001A.;15',USER='WWASSER',CD=';2-MAR-2016;14:44' -->
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ70001_1_59">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227533Z10-K_HTM_BG70001A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Canadian
	dollars. A weakening of the U.S. dollar in relation to the Canadian dollar would significantly increase our future costs relating to the production of our maple syrup products to the extent
	we have not purchased Canadian dollars or otherwise entered into a currency hedging arrangement in advance of any such weakening of the U.S. dollar. Our purchases of raw materials from other foreign
	suppliers
	are generally denominated in U.S. dollars, but certain purchases of raw materials in Mexico are denominated in Mexican pesos.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	a result, certain revenues and expenses have been, and are expected to be, subject to the effect of foreign currency fluctuations, and these fluctuations may have an adverse impact on
	operating results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Market Fluctuation Risks Relating to our Defined Benefit Pension Plans.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See Item&nbsp;7, "Management's Discussion and Analysis of
	Financial
	Condition and Results of Operations&#151;Critical Accounting Policies; Use of Estimates&#151;Pension Expenses" and Note 12, "Pension Benefits," to our consolidated financial statements
	in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of this report for a discussion of the exposure of our defined benefit pension plan assets to risks related to market fluctuations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	59
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<A NAME="A2227533Z10-K_HTM_H1">
</A>
	REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Board of Directors and Stockholders
<BR>
	B&amp;G Foods,&nbsp;Inc.:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of B&amp;G Foods,&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiaries as of January&nbsp;2, 2016 and January&nbsp;3, 2015, and the related
	consolidated statements of operations, comprehensive income, changes in stockholders' equity and cash flows for the fiscal years ended January&nbsp;2, 2016, January&nbsp;3, 2015 and
	December&nbsp;28, 2013. In connection with our audits of the consolidated financial statements, we also have audited the schedule of valuation and qualifying accounts. These consolidated financial
	statements and financial statement schedule are the
	responsibility of the Company's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these consolidated financial statements and financial statement schedule based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to
	obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in
	the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement
	presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of B&amp;G Foods,&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiaries as of
	January&nbsp;2, 2016 and January&nbsp;3, 2015, and the results of their operations and their cash flows for the fiscal years ended January&nbsp;2, 2016, January&nbsp;3, 2015 and
	December&nbsp;28, 2013, in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles. Also, in our opinion, the related financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic
	consolidated financial statements taken as a whole, presents fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), B&amp;G Foods,&nbsp;Inc.'s internal control over financial
	reporting as of January&nbsp;2, 2016, based on criteria established in Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework (2013) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway
	Commission (COSO), and our report dated March&nbsp;2, 2016 expressed an unqualified opinion on the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	/s/
	KPMG&nbsp;LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Short
	Hills, New Jersey
<BR>
	March&nbsp;2, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	61
</FONT>
</P>
